hero.title: About DevCodeJourney
hero.subtitle: Where code comes to life through stories and knowledge-sharing.

paragraphs: Hi, I'm Shubhojit Mitra, a Full Stack Next.js developer passionate about building scalable web applications with a focus on AI integrations, type-safety, and consistent user interfaces.

Currently working as an Online Python Tutor at Einstein Square, I help young students aged 8-13+ discover the joy of programming through Python, HTML, CSS, and beginner-level Java. I'm also the Lead Student Developer at the OPEN Community, where I guide student developers on technical projects and actively participate in OSOC (OPEN Summer of Code) discussions.

I believe in creating technology that's accessible, performant, and delightful to use. My educational background in BTech CSE with specialization in Full Stack Development from the University of Petroleum & Energy Studies has equipped me with a strong foundation in modern web development practices.

cards.title: Sharing Knowledge
cards.content: Programming is a continuous learning journey. By documenting my discoveries, challenges, and solutions, I hope to create resources that help other developers overcome similar obstacles more efficiently.

cards.title: Demystifying Complex Concepts
cards.content: Many programming concepts can seem intimidating at first. I break down these complex topics into digestible pieces, making them more approachable for developers at all skill levels.

cards.title: Building Community
cards.content: Writing creates opportunities for discussion and collaboration. I want to foster a community where we can learn from each other and collectively improve our craft.

howMyBlogsHelp.intro: My blog posts focus on practical, real-world applications of web development concepts. Whether you're looking to understand TypeScript better, explore the future of JavaScript, or build more scalable applications, my goal is to provide content that:
points: Accelerates your learning with clear, concise explanations
Provides practical code examples you can use in your own projects
Shares industry best practices and performance optimization techniques
Explores cutting-edge technologies and how they can solve real problems
Offers insights from my experiences working on diverse projects
howMyBlogsHelp.conclusion: I write the blogs I wish existed when I was learning - comprehensive yet accessible, technical yet practical, and always with the reader's growth in mind.
